In disadvantaged areas, 52 schools

are within a mile of a gas plant.

In other areas, only 28 schools

are within a mile of a gas plant.

Only a quarter of tracts in California are

classified as “disadvantaged,” but they are

home to almost two-thirds of schools sited

near gas plants.

If gas plants and schools were sited at the same

rate in disadvantaged and non-disadvantaged areas,

we would expect over 150 schools near plants in

non-disadvantaged areas. In reality, there are 28.
